Albania: George Kastrioti, later Skanderbeg, was born.
Armenia: After Tamerlane's death, Anatolia becomes a battleground between the rival tribal confederations of the Ak Koyunlu and the Kara Koyunlu.
China: Treasure voyages: The Yongle Emperor ordered a fleet of Chinese treasure ships under the command of the admiral Zheng He to reestablish tributary relationships with states in the South China Sea and Indian Ocean. The Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum was completed.
Indinesia: Paregreg war, Majapahit civil war of succession between Wikramawardhana against Wirabhumi. (to 1406)
Philippine: The Yongle Emperor instituted a Chinese envoy on Luzon during Zheng He's voyages and appointed Ko Ch'a-lao to that position in 1405. China also had vassals among the leaders in the archipelago. China attained ascendancy in trade with the area in Yongle's reign.
